text:
45% of all AI answers had at least one significant issue.
31% of responses had serious sourcing problems: missing, misleading or incorrect attributions.
20% contained major accuracy issues, including hallucinated details & outdated information.
Gemini had errors 76% of the time.

This will piss off the ChatGPT fanboys.

So, my friend just tested ChatGPT, DeepSeek, and Gemini on the same UI design challenge.

The winner isn't what the benchmarks told you.

Here's the real comparison no one's talking about:

Google just dropped it's ChatGPT killer

Google says Gemini beats GPT4 in 30 out of 32 benchmarks.

Here are 7 things you should know about:

ChatGPT (left)  vs.  Gemini 3.0  vs.  Grok 4.1 (right)  

Gemini finished in 40 seconds. ChatGPT failed. Took 2 minutes for Grok.
ChatGPT explaining why Gemini is better at this

ChatGPT o3 vs Gemini 2.5 Pro

Same prompts. Wildly different results.

THREAD ↓

I’m gong to have a moan chat gpt isn’t good Keeps on getting stuff wrong. Grok and gemini are far above chat gpt. 
5-6 times I asked chat gpt to do me a Lucky 15 for tomorrow it got it wrong every single time while when I asked gemini they got it right first time.
I agree, Gemini is better than ChatGPT in accuracy for now. Will try the Gemini Plus version to see how it works.

I ran the same prompts on ChatGPT 5.2 and Gemini 3.

The results shocked me.

ChatGPT felt like a senior engineer.
Precise. Logical. No fluff.

Gemini felt like a smart assistant.
Flexible. Practical. Plugged into real life.

Same task.
Very different brains.
